metadata.title: Test Governance Layer (TGL) - Constitutional Court for Code Verification

mission.strategic_objective: Deploy the Test Governance Layer (TGL) as the Constitutional Court for code verification, enforcing cryptographic proof of test execution quality through Ed25519 signatures. The TGL acts as the Magistrate of Code Verification, adjudicating TestExecutionManifests according to strict constitutional law.

operational_objectives.objective: All test execution manifests MUST be cryptographically signed with Ed25519 signatures
The TGL MUST operate in fail-closed mode: any signature verification failure results in REJECTION
The TGL MUST enforce 100.0% MCDC coverage (Modified Condition/Decision Coverage) with ZERO TOLERANCE for failures
The SemanticJudge MUST maintain an immutable audit trail of all adjudication decisions

invariant.name: Ed25519 Signature Requirement
invariant.description: All TestExecutionManifests submitted to the Constitutional Court MUST include a valid Ed25519 signature covering the canonical hash of the manifest. The signature proves authorship and integrity of the test execution evidence.
invariant.specification:
signature_hex = Ed25519.sign( private_key=agent_signing_key, message=canonical_hash.encode('utf-8') )
where canonical_hash = sha256( json.dumps(manifest_dict, sort_keys=True, separators=(',', ':')) )
invariant.enforcement: - Pydantic validator enforces 128-character hex pattern (64 bytes) - SemanticJudge.adjudicate() verifies signature using agent's registered public key - Invalid signatures result in JudgmentState.REJECTED

invariant.name: Fail-Closed Security Posture
invariant.description: The TGL operates with a fail-closed security model: any error in signature verification, unregistered agent, or missing public key results in immediate REJECTION with no fallback.
invariant.specification: IF agent_gid NOT IN judge.agent_public_keys THEN RETURN JudgmentState.REJECTED ELSIF NOT verify_signature(manifest.signature, public_key) THEN RETURN JudgmentState.REJECTED ELSIF manifest.tests_failed > 0 OR manifest.coverage.mcdc < 100.0 THEN RETURN JudgmentState.REJECTED ELSE RETURN JudgmentState.APPROVED END IF
invariant.enforcement: - SemanticJudge checks agent authorization before signature verification - BadSignatureError from PyNaCl library caught and converted to REJECTION - All rejection reasons logged to immutable audit trail

invariant.name: MCDC 100.0% Coverage Enforcement
invariant.description: The TGL enforces ZERO TOLERANCE for test coverage below 100.0% Modified Condition/Decision Coverage. This ensures every decision point in the code has been exercised in all possible outcome combinations.
invariant.enforcement: - Pydantic validator in CoverageMetrics class enforces at construction time - TestExecutionManifest.adjudicate() double-checks coverage requirement - SemanticJudge logs detailed rejection reasons for coverage failures

algorithm.name: Ed25519
algorithm.description: Ed25519 is a public-key signature system using elliptic curve cryptography. Provides 128-bit security level with fast verification and small signatures (64 bytes).

key_generation.code_example:
from nacl.signing import SigningKey from nacl.encoding import HexEncoder
# Generate new Ed25519 keypair signing_key = SigningKey.generate() verify_key = signing_key.verify_key
# Export keys as hex strings private_key_hex = signing_key.encode(encoder=HexEncoder).decode('utf-8') public_key_hex = verify_key.encode(encoder=HexEncoder).decode('utf-8')
# Key sizes: # - Private key: 32 bytes (64 hex characters) # - Public key: 32 bytes (64 hex characters) # - Signature: 64 bytes (128 hex characters)

signing_operation.code_example:
import hashlib from nacl.signing import SigningKey from nacl.encoding import HexEncoder
# Load agent's signing key signing_key = SigningKey(bytes.fromhex(private_key_hex))
# Compute canonical hash of manifest (excludes signature field) canonical_hash = manifest.compute_canonical_hash() message = canonical_hash.encode('utf-8')
# Sign the canonical hash signed = signing_key.sign(message) signature_hex = signed.signature.hex()
# Result: 128-character hex string (64 bytes)

verification_operation.code_example:
from nacl.signing import VerifyKey from nacl.exceptions import BadSignatureError from nacl.encoding import HexEncoder
# Load agent's public key verify_key = VerifyKey(bytes.fromhex(public_key_hex))
# Compute canonical hash message = manifest.compute_canonical_hash().encode('utf-8') signature = bytes.fromhex(manifest.signature)
# Verify signature (raises BadSignatureError if invalid) try: verify_key.verify(message, signature) return True except BadSignatureError: return False # Fail-closed

security_properties.property: Signatures are deterministic (same message + key = same signature)
Cannot forge signatures without private key (128-bit security)
Signatures prove both authenticity (who) and integrity (what)
Public key verification does not leak private key information

canonical_hash_computation.description: The canonical hash is a SHA-256 digest of the JSON-serialized manifest with signature field excluded and keys sorted for determinism.

implementation.code_example:
import hashlib import json
def compute_canonical_hash(self) -> str: # Serialize manifest to JSON (exclude signature, handle datetime) manifest_dict = self.model_dump(exclude={"signature"}, mode='json')
# Canonical JSON: sorted keys, no whitespace canonical_json = json.dumps( manifest_dict, sort_keys=True, separators=(',', ':') )
# SHA-256 hash hash_digest = hashlib.sha256(canonical_json.encode('utf-8')).hexdigest() return hash_digest

properties.property: Deterministic: same manifest content = same hash
Tamper-evident: any field modification changes the hash
Signature covers all manifest fields except signature itself
